segment.source: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.
segment.target: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.
segment.target: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.

segment.source: This method returns the data in JSON format.
segment.target: This method returns the data in JSON format.

segment.source: To use this method, you need to the following:
segment.target: To use this method, you need to the following:

segment.source: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.
segment.target: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.

segment.source: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.
segment.target: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.

segment.source: For more information, see Access analytics data using Windows Store services.
segment.target: For more information, see Access analytics data using Windows Store services.

segment.source: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearer token.
segment.target: The Azure AD access token in the form Bearer token.

segment.source: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve review data.
segment.target: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve review data.

segment.source: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the App identity page of the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the App identity page of the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: The start date in the date range of review data to retrieve.
segment.target: The start date in the date range of review data to retrieve.

segment.source: The default is the current date.
segment.target: The default is the current date.

segment.source: The end date in the date range of review data to retrieve.
segment.target: The end date in the date range of review data to retrieve.

segment.source: The default is the current date.
segment.target: The default is the current date.

segment.source: The number of rows of data to return in the request.
segment.target: The number of rows of data to return in the request.

segment.source: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.
segment.target: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.

segment.source: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.
segment.target: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.

segment.source: The number of rows to skip in the query.
segment.target: The number of rows to skip in the query.

segment.source: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.
segment.target: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.

segment.source: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.
segment.target: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.

segment.source: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
segment.target: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

segment.source: For more information, see the filter fields section below.
segment.target: For more information, see the filter fields section below.

segment.source: A statement that orders the result data values for each rating.
segment.target: A statement that orders the result data values for each rating.

segment.source: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:
segment.target: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:

segment.source: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.
segment.target: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.

segment.source: Here is an example orderby string: orderby=date,market
segment.target: Here is an example orderby string: orderby=date,market

segment.source: The filter parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
segment.target: The filter parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

segment.source: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the eq or ne operators, and some fields also support the contains, gt, lt, ge, and le operators.
segment.target: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the eq or ne operators, and some fields also support the contains, gt, lt, ge, and le operators.

segment.source: Statements can be combined using and or or.
segment.target: Statements can be combined using and or or.

segment.source: Here is an example filter string: filter=contains(reviewText,'great') and contains(reviewText,'ads') and deviceRAM lt 2048 and market eq 'US'
segment.target: Here is an example filter string: filter=contains(reviewText,'great') and contains(reviewText,'ads') and deviceRAM lt 2048 and market eq 'US'

segment.source: For a list of the supported fields and support operators for each field, see the following table.
segment.target: For a list of the supported fields and support operators for each field, see the following table.

segment.source: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the filter parameter.
segment.target: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the filter parameter.

segment.source: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the device market.
segment.target: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the device market.

segment.source: Specify true to filter for reviews that have been revised; otherwise false.
segment.target: Specify true to filter for reviews that have been revised; otherwise false.

segment.source: The version of the app package that was reviewed.
segment.target: The version of the app package that was reviewed.

segment.source: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.
segment.target: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.

segment.source: The device screen resolution in the format width x height.
segment.target: The device screen resolution in the format width x height.

segment.source: Specify true to filter for touch-enabled devices; otherwise false.
segment.target: Specify true to filter for touch-enabled devices; otherwise false.

segment.source: The number of times the review was marked helpful.
segment.target: The number of times the review was marked helpful.

segment.source: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.
segment.target: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.

segment.source: The text contents of the review.
segment.target: The text contents of the review.

segment.source: The text contents of the response.
segment.target: The text contents of the response.

segment.source: The date that the response was submitted.
segment.target: The date that the response was submitted.

segment.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
segment.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

segment.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
segment.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

segment.source: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.
segment.target: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.

segment.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
segment.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

segment.source: The following examples demonstrate several requests for getting review data.
segment.target: The following examples demonstrate several requests for getting review data.

segment.source: Replace the applicationId value with the product ID for your app.
segment.target: Replace the applicationId value with the product ID for your app.

segment.source: An array of objects that contain review data.
segment.target: An array of objects that contain review data.

segment.source: For more information about the data in each object, see the review values section below.
segment.target: For more information about the data in each object, see the review values section below.

segment.source: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.
segment.target: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.

segment.source: For example, this value is returned if the top parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.
segment.target: For example, this value is returned if the top parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.

segment.source: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.
segment.target: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.

segment.source: Elements in the Value array contain the following values.
segment.target: Elements in the Value array contain the following values.

segment.source: The first date in the date range for the ratings data.
segment.target: The first date in the date range for the ratings data.

segment.source: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.
segment.target: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.

segment.source: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.
segment.target: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.

segment.source: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving ratings data.
segment.target: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving ratings data.

segment.source: The display name of the app.
segment.target: The display name of the app.

segment.source: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the rating was submitted.
segment.target: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the rating was submitted.

segment.source: The OS version on which the rating was submitted.
segment.target: The OS version on which the rating was submitted.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The type of device on which the rating was submitted.
segment.target: The type of device on which the rating was submitted.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The value true indicates that the review was revised; otherwise false.
segment.target: The value true indicates that the review was revised; otherwise false.

segment.source: The version of the app package that was reviewed.
segment.target: The version of the app package that was reviewed.

segment.source: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.
segment.target: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.

segment.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.
segment.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the filter fields section above.

segment.source: The device screen resolution in the format "width x height".
segment.target: The device screen resolution in the format "width x height".

segment.source: The value true indicates that touch is enabled; otherwise false.
segment.target: The value true indicates that touch is enabled; otherwise false.

segment.source: The number of times the review was marked helpful.
segment.target: The number of times the review was marked helpful.

segment.source: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.
segment.target: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.

segment.source: The text contents of the review.
segment.target: The text contents of the review.

segment.source: The text contents of the response.
segment.target: The text contents of the response.

segment.source: The date a response was submitted.
segment.target: The date a response was submitted.

segment.source: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.
segment.target: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates an example JSON response body for this request.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates an example JSON response body for this request.

segment.source: Access analytics data using Windows Store services
